definitions.sensetop: not alone inbe alone with somebody/something

examples.text: Tom is not alone in finding Rick hard to work with.
She waited until she was alone with him to speak.
He was afraid of being alone with his thoughts.
He **lives alone**.
She was sitting **all alone** in the hall.
Finally the two of us were alone together.
I don't like going out alone at night.

definitions.definition: without the help of other people or things

examples.text: It's hard bringing up children alone.
The assassin said he had **acted alone**.

definitions.definition: lonely and unhappy or without any friends

examples.text: Carol **felt all alone** in the world.
I've been so alone since you went away.
He felt lost and completely alone.
I felt vulnerable and very much alone.
I've never felt so alone as I do now.

definitions.definition: used after a noun or pronoun to show that the person or thing mentioned is the only one

examples.text: You can't blame anyone else; you alone made the decision.

definitions.definition: used after a noun or pronoun to emphasize one particular thing

examples.text: The shoes alone cost £200.

definitions.definition: to do something without help from anyone

examples.text: Andrew decided to go it alone and start his own business.

definitions.definition: to stop annoying somebody or trying to get their attention

examples.text: She's asked to be left alone but the press photographers follow her everywhere.
Don't touch me! Leave me alone!

definitions.definition: to stop touching, changing, or moving something

examples.text: I've told you before—leave my things alone!

definitions.definition: used after a statement to emphasize that because the first thing is not true or possible, the next thing cannot be true or possible either

examples.text: There isn't enough room for us, let alone any guests.
I didn’t have any clothes, let alone a passport.

definitions.definition: to be independent or not connected with other people, organizations or ideas

examples.text: These islands are too small to stand alone as independent states.
The problems that research is designed to solve do not stand alone, but are part of a wider context.

definitions.definition: to be not near other objects or buildings

examples.text: The arch once stood alone at the entrance to the castle.

definitions.definition: used to say that you will have to wait for some time to find out the result of a situation

examples.text: Only time will tell if the treatment has been successful.
